title: Franklin 'can't wait' to coach again after PSU exit

content: There's no doubting Oscar Piastri's talent, but what's set him apart in his F1 title quest is his ability to control his emotions.

title: 'No agreement unless...': Centre's big update on India-US trade deal; talks 'not bound by deadline'
content: India and the US are progressing in trade agreement talks with a cordial atmosphere, according to Union Minister Piyush Goyal. New Delhi is committed to safeguarding the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and MSMEs, emphasizing that no agreement will be finalized without their protection. Discussions are constructive, aiming for a win-win solution to boost bilateral trade.

title: Bihar polls: Prashant Kishore exits political ring - Calculated gamble or misstep?
content: Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishor will not contest Bihar elections, aiming to disrupt the state's power dynamics instead. While rivals accuse him of accepting defeat, analysts suggest his focus on party candidates could be a strategic move. Kishor's ambitious target of winning over 150 seats will be tested against Bihar's complex political landscape.

title: Tragic! ICC condemns PAK's airstrike; mourns young Afghan players
content: Tragedy struck Afghan cricket as three young players, Kabeer Agha, Sibghatullah, and Haroon, were killed in a reported Pakistani aerial strike. The ICC condemned the violence, calling it a loss to the cricketing world. In protest, the Afghanistan Cricket Board withdrew from an upcoming tri-nation series in Pakistan, a decision supported by prominent players like Rashid Khan and Mohammad Nabi.

title: Upset Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says: Our market share has fallen to Zero from 95% in ...
content: Nvidia's advanced AI chip dominance in China has evaporated, dropping to zero due to US export controls. CEO Jensen Huang revealed the company is completely barred from selling high-performance chips, warning this exclusion harms both nations and cedes the market to domestic rivals like Huawei.  China's push for self-sufficiency accelerates this shift.

title: Blake Lively worried for Ryan Reynolds as Taylor Swift keeps her distance
content: Blake Lively is reportedly terrified about her husband Ryan Reynolds' future in Hollywood after Taylor Swift has allegedly cut ties with her. A source claims Swift has "totally shut her out," leaving Lively concerned about the repercussions of losing the pop star's influential friendship.

title: ScaleAl lays off an entire team; then invites employees to..
content: Scale AI has disbanded its Dallas-based New Projects Organization, a team of contractors focused on general AI chatbot improvement. This move, following a significant Meta investment, signals an industry pivot towards specialized, expert-level AI training in fields like medicine and robotics.  Affected workers received severance and were offered opportunities on Scale's gig platform.

title: IND vs AUS: 'It will be a very funny thing' - Kohli, Rohit get message ahead of 1st ODI
content: Virat Kohli returns to the Indian team for the ODI series in Australia. His childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma states Kohli has nothing left to prove. Sharma believes Kohli is well-prepared and will perform well. The series marks Kohli's first international appearance since March. His form and leadership will be closely watched. The matches are scheduled across Perth, Adelaide, and Sydney.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cuts Amazon share; slashes stake by $12.6B; increases charity
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, cutting holdings by nearly 42% to $12.6 billion. This reduction occurred despite Amazon's stock performance and follows her extensive philanthropic efforts, which have heavily focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. The exact reasons for the stake reduction, whether sales or donations, remain unspecified.

title: Bihar polls: Why Chirag Paswan is already a winner - even before 1st vote is cast
content: Chirag Paswan has emerged as a significant force within the NDA ahead of the Bihar elections. His party secured a substantial 29 seats in seat-sharing talks, more than any other junior ally. This success, coupled with a 100% win rate in the Lok Sabha polls, bolsters his bargaining power and positions him as a potential kingmaker in government formation.

title: Purge unlike any other: 9 top Chinese generals expelled ‚Äî Why Xi is cleaning house again
content: China's President Xi Jinping has purged nine top generals, including the second-highest-ranking officer, in a significant crackdown on the military. Accused of "seriously violating party discipline" and a "total collapse of beliefs," these expulsions escalate Xi's anti-corruption and loyalty campaign ahead of key personnel changes.

title: Bihar polls: JMM to contest independently; field candidates in six seats
content: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) will contest the Bihar assembly elections independently, fielding candidates in six seats. The party stated it would review its alliance with Congress and RJD in Jharkhand post-Bihar polls, citing a lack of a "respectful number of seats" offered by the INDIA bloc.

title: 'Every inch within range': Rajnath warns Pak, says Op Sindoor was 'just a trailer'
content: Describing BrahMos as a symbol of India‚Äôs rising strength, Singh said, "BrahMos is not just a missile, it is proof of India's strategic confidence. From the Army to the Navy and the Air Force, it has become a key pillar of our defence forces." He added that India‚Äôs defence capabilities now serve as a strong deterrent.

title: Ghastly! BCCI mourns Afghan cricketers killed in airstrike; shows solidarity with ACB
content: The BCCI expressed deep sorrow over the deaths of three young Afghan cricketers in a reported Pakistani aerial strike.  The Afghanistan Cricket Board has withdrawn from an upcoming tri-nation series in Pakistan due to the tragedy. Promising players Kabeer Agha, Sibghatullah, and Haroon were among eight civilians killed, prompting strong condemnation from Afghan cricket stars.

title: Happy Choti Diwali: 50+ wishes, thoughtful quotes and greetings
content: Choti Diwali, celebrated a day before Diwali, holds deep cultural and spiritual significance in India. This occasion emphasizes home cleansing, spreading joy, and exchanging heartfelt wishes and messages with loved ones. The article provides a collection of heartwarming wishes, thoughtful quotes, and personalized messages for family, friends, and colleagues to make greetings memorable.

title: 'Nuclearised environment': Munir at it again; makes unprovoked remark at Indian military
content: Pakistan army chief Asim Munir issued a stern warning to India, threatening a "decisive response" and "military and economic losses beyond imagination" amid border tensions. He placed the onus of any escalation on India, urging them to resolve core issues based on equality and mutual respect.

title: Explained: How New York‚Äôs rich and famous are panicking about Zohran Mamdani
content: New York's wealthiest are experiencing a unique panic as socialist mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani gains traction, challenging their long-held influence.  Despite attempts to counter his campaign with donations and backroom deals, Mamdani's message resonates with a younger, less affluent electorate, forcing the elite to confront their diminishing control over the city's future.

title: Yuvraj Singh mourns Afghan cricketers killed in Pakistan airstrikes
content: Tragedy struck Afghanistan's cricket fraternity as three young players were killed in a Pakistani airstrike near the border.  Former Indian cricketer Yuvraj Singh expressed deep sorrow, calling for peace. The Afghanistan Cricket Board confirmed the incident, leading to their withdrawal from an upcoming series.  Captain Rashid Khan and other players condemned the attack, mourning the loss of aspiring cricketers.

title: Bihar polls: Does Left hold key to MGB's victory? What battle of 2020 reveals
content: In Bihar's 2020 elections, the Left parties, particularly CPI(ML), showed a strong performance, nearly matching the BJP's strike rate. Five years later, they are pushing for a larger seat share in the Mahagathbandhan, citing their past success and widespread presence, though negotiations remain uncertain.

title: 'Foreign servant': JD Vance's old comment resurfaces, draws flak
content: Vice President JD Vance's resurfaced comments calling foreign talent as 'foreign servants' have sparked controversy. Critics, including social media users and former Biden adviser Ajay Bhutoria, have accused Vance of racism, pointing out his marriage to an Indian-origin woman and highlighting the contributions of immigrants to the US economy and innovation.

title: IND vs AUS:Records Virat Kohli can break; ODI series starts tomorrow
content: Virat Kohli returns for the ODI series against Australia. He is close to becoming the second-highest ODI run-scorer. Kohli also needs runs to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's combined limited-overs total. Another century will give him the record for most centuries in a single format. This tour also marks his preparation for the 2027 Cricket World Cup.

title: Not Elon Musk, this silent bureaucrat is reshaping America for Trump
content: Vought‚Äôs story begins far from the marble halls of Washington. Raised in a devout Christian household in Connecticut, he was steeped in a worldview that saw government authority as an extension of divine will. His mother founded a Bible-centric school where students were asked to ‚Äúdefend the statement that all governmental power comes from God.‚Äù

title: Ranji Trophy: Rinku surpasses Dravid, Jaiswal; scores career-best unbeaten 165
content: Rinku Singh's stellar 165 steered Uttar Pradesh to a draw against Andhra in their Ranji Trophy opener.  Coming in with UP struggling, Rinku's disciplined 273-ball innings, including a vital partnership, showcased his red-ball prowess.  This remarkable knock also saw him surpass notable Indian batters in first-class averages, highlighting his growing stature.

title: Vanessa Bryant and daughters erupt in joy after Ohtani leads Los Angeles Dodgers to NLCS victory
content: Vanessa Bryant, a devoted Los Angeles Dodgers fan, was recently seen cheering on the team with her daughters Bianka and Capri. The family celebrated as Shohei Ohtani led the Dodgers to an NLCS victory against the Milwaukee Brewers. Bryant also shared moments with Freddie Freeman's wife, Chelsea, at the star-studded game. The Dodgers defeated the Milwaukee Brewers with an overall score of 4-1.

title: Dhanteras 2025: How much will gold rise by next year & should you buy? Top points
content: Dhanteras 2025 gold buying: Investors who bet on gold and silver last Dhanteras and Diwali have seen bonanza returns. Are gold and silver good investment bets over the next year? We ask experts what the gold and silver price outlook is and what levels will they hit by Dhanteras 2026.

title: The mirror turns: Pak blames Afghanistan for terror; makes absurd India link
content: His comments came after at least six people, including two children, were killed and seven others injured in airstrikes conducted by Pakistan in Afghanistan‚Äôs southeastern Paktika province. The strikes reportedly violated a recent ceasefire agreement between the two countries. Media reports said that representatives from both sides are expected to meet in Doha, Qatar, to address the situation.

title: Mega Rayquaza raid day guide for Pokemon GO: Tips, rewards & details
content: Pokemon GO players can prepare for Mega Rayquaza Raid Day on October 18, 2025. This global event features special raids for the powerful sky dragon. Trainers have a chance to encounter Shiny Rayquaza and earn exclusive rewards. Special tickets offer additional bonuses. Players need Meteorites to teach Rayquaza Dragon Ascent. Ice-type Pok√©mon are recommended for raids.

title: Who were the Afghan cricketers killed by Pakistan air strike?
content: Three young Afghan cricketers were among eight civilians killed in a reported Pakistani aerial strike, prompting Afghanistan to withdraw from an upcoming tri-nation series. The incident, occurring shortly after a ceasefire, has intensified tensions between the two nations. Prominent Afghan players have condemned the attack as barbaric and a heinous crime.

title: Delhi: AQI worsens in several parts of the city
content: Raising concern regarding higher levels of AQI, Pulmonologist Dr. Sharad Joshi from Ghaziabad said, "Air Quality Index (AQI) has risen significantly, leading to higher levels of particulate pollutants from sources like crop burning, vehicular exhaust, and fireworks. This exacerbates respiratory issues for those with conditions such as COPD, asthma, or a history of tuberculosis, causing symptoms like cough, fever, breathlessness, and chest pain."

title: Raj Babbar ‚Äònever picked up work on Diwali‚Äô; son Aarya Babbar reveals it is a tradition in the family - Exclusive
content: Bollywood actor Aarya Babbar reveals Diwali at his home is a cherished family tradition, emphasizing togetherness and simple rituals. He shares that his father, Raj Babbar, instilled a strict no-work policy during the festival, a sentiment echoed by the entire family and respected by the film industry. Celebrations include prayers, new attire, eco-friendly crackers, and shared sweets.

title: Shami hits back at chief selector Agarkar: 'It is all in front of your eyes'
content: Pacer Mohammed Shami has hit back at chief selector Ajit Agarkar's fitness concerns following a stellar Ranji Trophy performance. Shami, who took seven wickets against Uttarakhand, questioned the selectors' stance, stating his bowling speaks for itself. Agarkar had previously cited fitness issues as the reason for Shami's exclusion from the ODI squad, but the bowler's recent display challenges this narrative.

title: Caught on cam: Woman robbed, fingers severed with machete in Bengaluru; 2 arrested
content: Two men have been arrested for a brutal robbery in Bengaluru where a woman's fingers were severed with a machete. The accused attacked two women returning from a festival, snatching gold chains and inflicting severe injuries when one resisted. CCTV footage captured the disturbing incident.

title: SSC CHSLE 2025: Candidates can now choose exam city, date and shift for CBT from 12 November
content: SSC CHSLE slot selection 2025: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has opened the self-slot selection portal for CHSLE 2025 Tier 1, starting November 12, 2025. Candidates can choose their exam city, date, and shift between October 22 and October 28. If preferred slots are unavailable, alternative cities will be offered. No changes will be allowed after selection. Non-selection will be treated as unwillingness to appear. A detailed guide with screenshots will be available on the candidate portal.

title: 'Gill has shown he can lead with results': Former WC-winning captain
content: Diwali week ignites cricket excitement with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's return to India's ODI squad. New white-ball captain Shubman Gill receives praise from Aaron Finch, who believes it's the right time for his leadership. Both Rohit and Virat will play under a new captain for the first time since 2016.

title: Dhanteras 2025: Shubh Muhurat to buy Gold and Silver
content: Dhanteras, marking the start of Diwali, falls on October 18, 2025. This auspicious day signifies wealth and prosperity, making it ideal for purchasing gold and silver. Devotees honor Lord Kuber and Goddess Laxmi, seeking blessings for good fortune. Several auspicious timings, or shubh muhurats, are available throughout October 18th and 19th for these significant purchases.

title: Fire at MPs' complex: Blaze hits Brahmaputra Apartments in Delhi; 12 tenders rushed
content: A swift response from emergency services contained a fire at Brahmaputra Apartments, a Rajya Sabha members' residential complex on Bishambhar Das Marg, New Delhi. Firefighters, arriving promptly with 12 tenders, successfully extinguished the blaze by 2:10 pm after receiving the alert at 1:22 pm. Cooling operations were underway following the incident.

title: Parineeti Chopra heads to Delhi as pregnancy nears delivery, baby expected soon - Report
content: Parineeti Chopra has moved to Delhi as she prepares to welcome her first child with husband Raghav Chadha. The couple announced their pregnancy in August 2025 with a heartfelt Instagram post. Celebrities showered them with congratulations, and Raghav teased good news on The Kapil Sharma Show.

title: Maharashtra: 8 dead, 8 injured as vehicle falls at Chandshali Ghat in Nandurbar
content: At least eight individuals lost their lives and eight others sustained injuries in a tragic accident in Maharashtra's Nandurbar district on Saturday. The vehicle reportedly fell at Chandshali Ghat within the Shahada police jurisdiction. The injured are currently receiving medical attention at a local hospital.

title: Bihar polls: 8 INDIA bloc allies risk friendly fights as multiple candidates stay in fray
content: INDIA bloc partners faced a seat-sharing deadlock as nominations closed for the first phase of elections. Despite the impasse, candidates filed papers, with eight seats seeing friendly fights. VIP founder Mukesh Sahani opted out of contesting to focus on campaigning for the alliance's victory and a potential deputy CM role.

content: North Bengal is today popular like never before among tourists from Kolkata and around, with the traffic rising steadily by about 15% every year, tour operators said

content: Legal experts said the apex court‚Äôs judgment restores faith in judicial oversight, reminding citizens that due process is the ‚Äúheart and soul‚Äù of democracy; the judgment will also curb the menace of misusing the legislation

title: NHRC issues notice to States, UTs to check ‚Äòharassment‚Äô of roadside vendors during Deepavali
content: In a notice issued on October 17, NHRC member Priyank Kanoongo cited a complainant who alleged that roadside vendors were being subjected to unnecessary and inhumane treatment by Municipal authorities across various cities in India.

title: Capitalism has reached a cul-de-sac: Prabhat Patnaik
content: He says the immense rise in income inequality in every country under the neoliberal regime has brought about a stagnation of the system

content: The Council transitioned to the Telangana Council of Higher Education Act, 2024, to establish an independent governance framework

title: Hours-long traffic snarl-up brings Amballur in Thrissur to a grinding halt
content: Congestion on the national highway, which began in the afternoon, persisted well into the evening, leaving hundreds of motorists frustrated and exhausted

content: Children should grow up in schools that reflect society, not segregated by caste but united in diversity, A. Revanth Reddy told Chairperson of The Hindu Group of Publications Nirmala Lakshman who called on him and also on Deputy Chief Minister M. Bhatti Vikramarka

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Bihar migrants, home for the festive season, are critical voters
content: Migrant voters expected to play a major role in constituencies in northwestern Bihar; Prashant Kishor‚Äôs new Jan Suraaj Party has made some inroads among them, but they are not promising their votes yet

title: NMC approves 106 new PG seats for government medical colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: The State government submitted a proposal to the NMC in 2024, seeking approval for additional PG seats in government medical colleges

title: Music Is Medicine: US Nurse Plays Ukulele To Help Patients In Pain
content: Nurse Rod Salaysay works with all kinds of instruments in the hospital: A thermometer, a stethoscope and sometimes his guitar and ukulele.

title: 'We Love America, Not Trump': Millions Rally In US 'No Kings' Protests
content: Huge crowds are expected to hit the streets Saturday from New York to San Francisco to vent their anger over President Donald Trump's hardline policies at nationwide "No Kings" protests slammed by Republicans as "Hate America" rallies.

title: Burnt Voter Records Found Near Ex-BJP MLA's Home Amid 'Vote Theft' Probe
content: Heaps of burnt voter records were found near former BJP MLA Subhash Guttedar's residence in the district on Saturday as the SIT intensified its probe into alleged 'vote theft' in the Aland assembly segment during the 2023 assembly elections.

title: PM Modi, Rishi Sunak, Ishaan Khatter: Highlights Of NDTV World Summit 2025
content: ¬†The 2025 edition of the two-day NDTV World Summit concluded on Saturday, with global leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, delivering powerful speeches and taking part in impactful discussions on a range of issues.¬†

title: Delhi Surgeon, Accused Of Harassment By Nurse, Not Suspended, AIIMS Clarifies
content: Senior surgeon AK Bisoi hasn't been suspended as the head of the Cardio Thoracic and Vascular Surgery (CTVS), AIIMS Delhi said today. The clarification came after reports claimed Bisoi was suspended following a complaint of harassment by a nurse.

title: Burning Ship Loaded With Petroleum Gas Abandoned In Gulf Of Aden Off Yemen
content: A Cameroonian-flagged ship caught fire Saturday in the Gulf of Aden off Yemen after possibly being struck by a projectile, officials said, with at least one mariner missing and another still likely aboard the burning tanker.

title: "No Friendly Fight, Enemy Is Enemy": Hemant Soren's Party To Go Solo In Bihar
content: Hemant Soren's Jharkhand Mukti Morcha declared today that it would contest the elections in Bihar on its own, creating another rift within the Opposition Grand Alliance. The party made no secret that it is now on the warpath.

title: Mithai, Gadgets, And Wellness Gifts Fill Shoppers' Bags This Diwali Season
content: Tis' the season of giving, and wrapped in glittering paper and tied with a bow, Diwali gifts are here to make the festive moments a little bit brighter and happier.

title: Returning For Diwali, Hundreds Stranded In Italy As Air India Cancels Flight
content: Hundreds of passengers returning to India from Italy for Diwali were in for a rude shock on Friday when they were told their Air India flight had been cancelled and they would be booked on flights only on the day of the festival or after that.

title: Zubeen Garg Case: 9 Arrested For Violence During Shifting Of Accused To Jail
content: Nine people have been arrested so far in connection with violence during the shifting of five accused in Zubeen Garg's death case to a jail in Assam's Baksa district, police said on Saturday.

title: Uttarakhand To Relax Civil Code Rules: What Live-In Couples Need To Know
content: The Uttarakhand government has filed a 78-page affidavit in the high court saying that a few provisions of rules under the Uniform Civil Code are being amended.

title: Gaza Death Count Tops 68,000 As Israel Identifies Remains Of 1 More Hostage
content: Israel said the remains of another hostage that Hamas handed over the day before were identified as Eliyahu Margalit, as the Palestinian death count surpassed 68,000 people amid searching beneath the rubble.

title: "What If I Don't Die?" Axis Max Life CEO Sumit Madan On Often Asked Question About Life Insurance
content: Imagine buying a beautiful car, something you've always desired. Maybe it's a bottle green Bentley or something like that, right? Or a really expensive electric vehicle.

title: Cracks Evident In Mahayuti As Senior Leaders Swipe At Each Other
content: As tensions rise between Mahayuti partners Shiv Sena and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) ahead of local body polls, senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader and minister Chhagan Bhujbal launched a sharp attack on the BJP.

title: "Should Look At All Options": Harvard Professor On Indians Wanting To Study In US
content: Urging India to invest more in science, Tarun Khanna, the Jorge Paulo Lemann professor at the Harvard Business School, has said no country has escaped middle-income status without doing so.

title: "Biggest Phobia" About Electric Vehicles: Experts Give Their Take
content: Vehicles that run on electricity are the future but the technology is still in nascent stage. The need of the hour is to adopt it for public transport and alongside it, assuaging the concerns of customers, said a team of experts and entrepreneurs.

title: Fire At Dhaka Airport's Cargo Section, All Flight Operations Suspended
content: A major fire broke out at the cargo terminal of Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka on Saturday, forcing the suspension of all flights.

title: Taiwan's Main Opposition Elects New Leader Amid Claims Of Chinese Meddling
content: Taiwan's main opposition Nationalist Party chose a former lawmaker as its new chairperson on Saturday in a competitive election clouded by allegations of China's meddling.

title: The Great INDIA Bloc Muddle: A Comedy Of Errors In Bihar
content: In the unfolding drama of the Bihar assembly polls, the INDIA bloc - an alliance that once promised a united front against the ruling NDA - has transformed into a farcical spectacle of misalignment and muddle.

title: IIT Bombay Alumnus Secretly Films Male Students In Hostel, Case Filed
content: Police have registered a case against a 32-year-old former student of IIT Bombay for allegedly secretly recording videos of the male students residing in the institute's hostel while they were taking bath, officials said on Friday.

title: Amount of subsidies provided by T.N. government rise between 2019-20 and 2023-24
content: A perusal of the report of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India on State Finances for¬†2023-24 reveals that the amount of subsidies rose from ‚Çπ20,114 crore during 2019-20 to ‚Çπ37,749 crore during 2023-24

title: March to NSS headquarters seeks Sukumaran Nair‚Äôs exit
content: When authorities denied protesters‚Äô request to offer floral tributes at the Mannathu¬†Padmanabhan memorial located inside the NSS headquarters, they performed the ritual on the road in front of the community leader‚Äôs portrait

title: BJP A.P. chief urges people to buy indigenous products this festive season
content: P.V.N. Madhav highlights importance of supporting local firecrackers and diyas, stresses communal harmony

title: Allahabad High Court slams U.P. police for illegally detaining interfaith couple under ‚Äòsocial pressure‚Äô
content: The court said that the State government and its law enforcement machinery are expected to use their power to protect the liberty of a citizen and not to succumb to social pressures and curtail freedom

title: International fake currency racket busted in Rajasthan, seven members arrested
content: The gang members, operating a fake currency racket across Rajasthan and Haryana, were making counterfeit ‚Çπ500 and ‚Çπ2,000 notes, resembling the genuine Indian currency, and circulating them through intermediaries

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister shares U.S. response to Sundar Pichai‚Äôs Visakhapatnam AI hub proposal
content: The U.S. Under Secretary of State praises Google‚Äôs plan to bring its full AI stack to Andhra Pradesh, highlighting opportunities for American firms and strengthening the U.S.‚ÄìIndia innovation corridor

title: Deserts tell stories of sustainability, resilience, says writer Muzafer Ahamed¬†
content: Travel writing can be anything, it can be political, subjective, and sometimes it reveals who the author really is rather than the destination, says Booker Prize winning Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunathilaka

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Jolt for NDA after LJP(RV) candidate‚Äôs nomination papers rejected
content: Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) candidate Seema Singh nomination papers was rejected during the scrutiny in Marhaura assembly seat

title: Karnataka Forest Minister Khandre warns of strict action against forest encroachment
content: The Minister says reckless exploitation of natural resources driven by human greed had led to widespread pollution of air, water, and food, resulting in serious health issues.

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu keen to address employees‚Äô issues, says Group of Ministers
content: The GoM tells representatives of the government employees‚Äô unions and associations that efforts are under way to concede their demands to the extent possible in spite of constraints

title: History-sheeter dies after being shot at by police in Vijayapura district
content: A history-sheeter who was shot in the leg by the Police, after he tried to escape by assaulting them in Rampur (PA) village of Sindgi taluk of Vijayapura district, breathed his last on Saturday.

title: SIT examining the money trail in Sabarimala gold ‚Äòtheft‚Äô case
content: The team inspects the house of prime suspect Unnikrishnan Potti purportedly for confiscating financial records to pinpoint the alleged amassing of unaccountable wealth.¬†Cyberforensic sleuths are checking Mr. Potti‚Äôs mobile phone record logs to trace his online financial transactions

title: India-E.U. trade talks: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal to visit Brussels October end
content: Engagements between the two sides have increased as they have decided to conclude the negotiations by December

title: BRS hits out at Congress, BJP for enacting dramas in BC quota name
content: Former Minister Harish Rao says nobody could stop quota hike if the two parties join hands in Parliament on the issue

title: Dugong conservation centre being planned in ‚ÄòNo-Development Zone‚Äô sparks concern
content: A fishing community leader says this does not comply with the CRZ Notification; according to activists, a concrete building offers little benefit to dugongs, whose conservation depends on protecting their natural habitat

title: Countries vote to delay implementation of carbon-free shipping plan
content: Member countries of the International Maritime Organization postpone the plan amid threats from U.S. President Donald Trump. The strategic plan was aimed at moving the shipping industry away from the use of fossil fuel.

title: Kerala has not benefited from GST regime, finds Estimates Committee of the State Assembly
content: Panel recommends to conduct a comparative study of pre-GST and post-GST revenue growth and an assessment of revenue growth in a hypothetical scenario where the GST was not introduced

title: 3,397 people booked in 3,209 NDPS cases this year
content: Of the 3,209 cases, 18 are related to seizure of narcotic items in commercial quantity, which varies according to the nature of the substance; 475 kg of suspected ganja seized this year

title: Raebareli lynching case: two more held, total arrests 16 so far
content: Following the attack, police registered a case and arrested 14 people, including the main accused, who was held after an encounter on October 10

title: Police constable arrested in Belagavi for stabbing estranged wife to death
content: A police constable has hacked his estranged wife to death in Belagavi district. The brutal murder, which took place on October 13, came to light on Friday

title: KL Deemed to be University in A.P. launches three satellites designed by its students
content: CAN SAT satellite of KLU students has been selected for ‚ÄòMake in India‚Äô and ‚ÄòAtmanirbhar‚Äô competitions, scheduled to be held in Uttar Pradesh on October 27

title: PM a mauni baba, says Congress in dig at Modi after President Trump repeats his claim about Russian oil imports

title: Dragunov returns, Rhodes DQ, more

title: NHL Power Rankings: Canes on top, one futures bet for each team
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . previous ranking: 2 Points percentage: 100% Hurricanes win the Stanley Cup (+800). the first two games showcased Carolina's depth .

title: Ranking the top 25 college football players midway through the 2025 season
content: a midseason top 25 is supposed to look like a major league baseball all-star team . it's hard to separate the flash in the pan from the real deal . a bunch of players we love didn't make the cut . the good news is that a few of the biggest names don't keep this hot start through December .

title: 2025-26 coaching hot seat, retirement guide
content: bob greene: the tectonic shift that deals and revenue sharing have sparked in college sports has not spared the men's basketball coaching carousel and the hot seat discussion . he says it's now clear that patience is at an all-time low if new hires aren't cutting it after two years, they're likely getting forced out the door or at least under significant pressure .

title: Chargers' new 'Charger Power' alternate, Lions' all-black lead NFL Week 7 uniforms
content: it's the first time in franchise history the Chargers will wear a gold jersey . the look is meant to channel the energy and "progressive nature" of the air coryell days . on "Thursday Night Football," the Cincinnati Bengals are hosting their annual "White Bengal" game .

title: The vibes are unusually high for the Giants: 'When you have that kind of spark... it raises everyone's level'
content: new: "the energy is there," tight end says of the team atmosphere . "Get Up" is the result of winning two of three games since rookie Jaxson Dart became the starting quarterback . it's the ultimatum for the Giants to win a game against the Eagles .

title: India-China direct flights: China Eastern to resume Shanghai-Delhi route after 5 yrs
content: India and China had 539 direct flights operated by airlines including Air India, IndiGo, China Southern and China Eastern . in march 2020, international flights were halted during Covid . thrice-weekly service between Shanghai and Delhi from November 9 .
